page.title: 06THE LEGEND OF THE LOCH
page.content: One of the most well-known stories about the{wizard}was that he boasted that he could drive a carriage,drawn by two horses across the Loch of Skene on the first night it was frozen over. On the{first frosty night,}he told his coachman to drive the horses at full gallop.When they set out over the loch there was said to have been a terrible noise_demons groaning and lashing the water in their anger.When the horses and the front wheels of the carriage reached land the{coachman}looked round and saw the{Devil}himself sitting beside the Laird.At this very moment the back wheels crashed through the ice and{two black dogs}were seen to plunge into the water.Many of the older people of Skene still say today that marks of the{carriage wheels}are still seen clearly when the Loch of Skene is frozen over.
